entities: United Nations Mission in Côte d'Ivoire
Economic Community of Western African States
summary:
The Security Council,
 Recalling previous resolutions 1528 (2004), 1572 (2004) and 1584 (2005), 
 Reaffirming commitment to Côte d’Ivoire’s sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity and unity, 
 Endorsing Linas-Marcoussis and Accra III Agreements, 
 Welcoming efforts of Secretary-General, African Union and Economic Community of Western African States, 
 Determining situation in Côte d’Ivoire poses threat to international peace and security, 
 Acting under Chapter VII, 
1. Extends mandate of UN Mission in Côte d’Ivoire and French forces for one month until 4 May 2005; 
2. Calls on Ivorian parties to pursue lasting solution through African Union mediation; 
3. Decides to remain seized of the matter
